intro: Paypayrola brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian paypayrola, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Paypayrola brasiliensis is adapted to the humid and warm conditions of the tropical environment.
